reviews.review_msg: Nice guy. Boring course, slaps on unthoughtful marks on assignments. Is spaced out a lot goes off on tangents. No need to actually do any of the readings, just focus on your project. Gives no guidelines to anything but expects you to psychic-ly know how to do the assignments to perfection.

I took PSYC 450 in Fall 2020 and absolutely looked forward to class each week. Readings were highly relevant and interesting. Class discussions were engaging. I found I learned so much. Tanya also pushed me to think harder and better operationalize what I was saying. I would take this class again in a heartbeat.

Tanya is so amazing! Lectures/discussions were always engaging. She gave great feedback on weekly critiques and was beyond flexible throughout the term (which was appreciated during this challenging term). She was also very helpful with our final papers to ensure each student was able to be successful-this class is a must take/highly suggest Tanya

Honestly one of the most pleasant people I came across at SFU. She got me interested in everything she studied even though I didn't find them particularly interesting before. I took her 250 & 450 classes & learned more in these than all other psyc classes COMBINED. Her interest in the topics shine in her lectures which makes them very engaging
